title: Noble Lady Of Caelin
opening: In Laus, Erik tells Eliwood of a plan. A plot to use Laus as starting ground in a rebellion against Ostia. Eliwood needs proof to believe these accusations, and so he and his allies pursue Darin, the fleeing marquess of Laus. Where that chase would lead, Eliwood could not have known.

After repelling the mercenary forces of Eubans, Hector prepares to mount a pursuit of Marquess Laus. Lord Darin and his knights are with the instigator of the rebellion, the enigmatic Ephidel. Hector learns where the fugitives were traveling from Ostia’s network of spies. However, their final destination still remains unknown…

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Blast! Where on earth has that snake Darin gone?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I doubt he’s left Lycia yet, but… Hector…it’s been five days. The death of Marquess Santaruz… Our attack on Laus Castle… Word of these things must have reached Lord Uther by now. And yet he shows no sign of action… Why?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I’m sure he has his reasons. My brother has other concerns tying his hands right now.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: It’s Bern. We’ve received disturbing reports over the past few months. King Desmond is behaving oddly. If he sees even the slightest crack in Lycia’s defenses, we believe he’ll invade with all of Bern’s might behind him. My brother has only recently become marquess, as well as head of the Lycian League. He can’t allow another country to see weakness or discord.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: He has to present the face of stability and strength, is that it?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Yes. It seems every country has a spy working in Ostia right now. They all want to assess the new marquess’s temperament and skill. If they sense anything wrong, word will spread like wildfire.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector, you’re the marquess’s brother… Would not being at his side be seen as something “wrong”?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: The marquess’s brother is a well-known lout. If I WERE at court, they’d sense something wrong.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: You’re not too proud of that reputation, are you?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Not in the least.

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Lord Hector! Lord Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What is it, Oswin? Have you heard something?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Yes, my lord. A messenger from the east! Castle Caelin has fallen to a surprise attack from Marquess Laus!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Castle Caelin!?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: They’ve struck again.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Lord Hausen… Is he unharmed?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: My apologies, my lord… We’ve no word on Lord Hausen or his granddaughter, the lady Lyndis.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I never imagined they would attack Caelin… Lord Hausen… Lyndis…

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Lord Hector… What should we do?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: They might still be alive, right? There’s only one thing we can do!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Come on! We’ve got to hurry!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Milady, I’ve returned, and I have brought news. Laus soldiers are scattered from the castle to the edge of this forest. There must be at least 50 soldiers!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Are you sure about this, milady? We barely escaped… Going back to the castle would mean almost certain death.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: My grandfather is in the castle. I left the castle on his orders, but… I can’t leave him in there alone!

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: The numbers we face… Rescuing Lord Hausen will be no easy task.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: I wonder if we can expect any reinforcements.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: I overheard some of the Laus soldiers talking. They claim that Lord Eliwood invaded Laus and drove them out.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Eliwood? Why would he attack Laus?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: It gets even more interesting… Not only did Marquess Laus abandon his castle, but he also left his son, Erik, behind when he fled here to Caelin.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: That’s despicable! He abandoned his own son?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: But at least we know Eliwood is in Laus. We might be able to ask him for help. …Assuming there were a way to contact him.

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: If we are to avoid being caught, the best path would be through the forest. Shall I go?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I suspect you’re right. Horses cannot move well in woods… It’ll take you a while, but you can travel lightly…

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Lady Lyndis! I’ll go! I can fly above the forest. I can be in Laus faster than anyone else.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Florina? You can’t do this on your own! It’s not possible!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Thanks to my time here, I’m no longer as timid around men as I used to be. And I’ve met Lord Eliwood before. I’m sure I can do this on my own.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: It will be terribly dangerous… You understand, don’t you?

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Yes. But… I promised myself I would become braver for you. I’m not the weak little Florina I used to be. I’ll be fine. Trust me.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You’ve convinced me. The job’s yours, Florina. But you must promise me that you won’t try anything impossible!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Yes, my lady. Farewell!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Did you hear our meek Florina? She sounded most forceful! Beautiful!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: She’s become a full-fledged pegasus knight.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Yes, she has.

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: All for you, Lady Lyndis. That’s quite gallant.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: When we lived on the plains, I was always her protector. I know I shouldn’t feel sad, and yet…

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Commander Bauker! There’s something in the southern skies.

intro.speaker: Bauker
intro.line: Is that…a pegasus knight? Where do you suppose she’s going? It doesn’t matter. We’ve been told not to let anyone out of Caelin. Archers! Advance! Bring her down!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: To reach Laus, I must go over the forest…and fly north. Then, I’ll have to… Wait! Who are those people? They fly no banner, and yet… Ah! That man in the lead! It’s Lord Eliwood! He’s come to Caelin’s aid! That’s wonderful. I have to tell him where Lady Lyndis is waiting!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I’ve spotted the enemy… Why are their archers advancing? They’re aiming at something up high.”

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Lord Eliwood, look! Up there! A pegasus knight!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Lord Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Could it really be… Florina, is that you?

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Yes! I’m Lady Lyndis’s…

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Florina! Fly lower!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Wha–Oh! Aaaaaaah!!!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Florina!!!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oooh!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: …… Ah…

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Can you hear me? Florina?

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Lord Eliwood?… I…

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Those archers almost hit you. You avoided the arrows, but you lost your balance and fell.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: And yet… I’m not hurt. I fell from such a height. What–

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You got lucky. I didn’t. You landed right on top of me!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Oh!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector saved you.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I saved no one! I simply gave her someplace soft to land! A bale of hay could have done more than I did.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Eeek! Oh… Oh, I’m so sorry!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: You were lucky, Florina. If you had fallen on me, I couldn’t have caught you. Or your pegasus either!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: They fell one after the other! I couldn’t get out of the way!

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: M-M-My pegasus, too? I am so… I’m truly… I don’t know what to say! I…um… I……

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: No apology needed. You do need to tell us why you’re here, however.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Yes, of… of course! Lord Eliwood, Lady Lyndis is beyond that forest. She’s waiting for a chance to assault the castle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: She’s what!? Ah… Still, it’s good to hear she’s safe.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: She’s fine. However, Lord Hausen’s been captured. He’s still in the castle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I see. Let’s go then!

intro.speaker: Bauker
intro.line: Someone get up there and scour the area! I want to know if we brought down that pegasus knight! If she’s still breathing, make her stop!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: My lord! To the west! We’re under attack! It’s the Pheraen noble, Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Bauker
intro.line: He’s here, eh? Now’s our chance to show Marquess Laus our loyalty. Our opponents are a motley band of fools! They’re no match for us!

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: Pherae's new tactician... It was you all along, wasn't it, Mark? Me? I'm still traveling in pursuit of knowledge. I'll never outstrip my tutor, but I'm getting a bit closer... Well, Mark, tell me what you need me to do.

battle.speaker: Florina
battle.line: Uh... Mark... Um... It's me... Florina. Um... I'm... I'm over here.

battle-talk.speaker: Eliwood
battle-talk.line: Lyn!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Eliwood?! You came here?

battle-talk.speaker: Eliwood
battle-talk.line: Florina told us where you were. We're here to help.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Thank you!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Are you an ally, too?

battle-talk.speaker: Hector
battle-talk.line: Yep, that's what it looks like.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: In that case, I have something to tell you.

battle-talk.speaker: Hector
battle-talk.line: We're a bit busy now. Save it for later.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: What? Hold on! Wait just a minute!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Whew…I’m sorry, Makar. You must be all tired out from all the flying we’ve done. You need some water. That’s a good boy.

battle-talk.speaker: Hector
battle-talk.line: Hey, you! You’re in the way! Move!!!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Kyaaaa!

battle-talk.speaker: Hector
battle-talk.line: This is a battlefield! It’s not a stable! I’m not picking you up if you get shot down again!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Oh…uhm… Excuse me…it’s… Lord Hector, isn’t it? I…well…it’s…

battle-talk.speaker: Hector
battle-talk.line: Oh, hey! Eliwood! It’s the…

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Ah…

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Hey you! You're ...

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: Um... No I'm not. You've got the wrong fellow... Bye now!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Stop right there Matthew!

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: Saw right through my disguise, didn't you lady Lyndis?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: What are you talking about? How could I not recognise you? You're... You!

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: Yes, but I had to at least try to fool you. Being memorable is not the best quality for a spy to have.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Spy? I thought you were a thief!

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: Oops!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: What's this about? Come on, tell me!

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: I can't it's a secret.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: A secret? Would you have your mouth sealed if you spoke it?

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: You're very knowledgeable!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Very well, I'll ask no more questions. If you have any trouble, though, you can talk to me. I'm sure I'll be able to help. (Leaves)

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: Ahhh, Lady Lyndis? I believe you are the one currently in trouble. You're either generous to a fault or something altogether.

battle-talk.speaker: Serra
battle-talk.line: Ah! Lyn! I'm so happy to see you safe!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Serra! What are you doing in Caelin?

battle-talk.speaker: Serra
battle-talk.line: I'm with Lord Hector. We've come to save you!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Hector?

battle-talk.speaker: Serra
battle-talk.line: Oh, come now! Lord Hector! Marquess Ostia's younger brother! He's a good friend of Lord Eliwood's by the way.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Oh...I see. Well, thank you for coming, Serra. I'm glad to see you again.

battle-talk.speaker: Serra
battle-talk.line: It's no trouble at all! When a dear friend's in trouble, you have to help. It's a rule!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: A dear friend?

battle-talk.speaker: Serra
battle-talk.line: Don't worry. Social positions never bother me. I know we'll get along well, Lyn!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Florina!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Lady Lyndis!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: You're unharmed! I'm so relieved. Really!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Was my service at all helpful?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Of course it was! You saved us! Thank you!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Tee hee! I'll do even better next time!

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: I'm counting on it!

battle-talk.speaker: Erk
battle-talk.line: Lady Lyndis, please stay back. I'll serve as the advance guard.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Hm? You... Is that you, Erk?

battle-talk.speaker: Erk
battle-talk.line: Yes, my lady. A pleasure to see you.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Erk, why are you here in Caelin?

battle-talk.speaker: Erk
battle-talk.line: For reasons of my own, I've joined up with Eliwood's company. We're here to rescue Caelin. Please, Lady Lyndis, would you kindly withdraw?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: My grandfather is in the castle. I'm not going to retreat from this battle!

battle-talk.speaker: Erk
battle-talk.line: You might be a noblewoman, but you haven't changed at all. Very well, at least stay near me. I'll be your escort.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Thank you Erk.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Dorcas! Dorcas, is that you?

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: Glad you're well, Lyn.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: What are you doing in Caelin?

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: I'm working for a Pheraen nobleman. When talk came of Caelin, he grew worried about you. Looks like we got here in time...

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Yes, thank you. However, my grandfather is still in the castle.

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: I understand. Let's do what we can do.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Dorcas? Is Natalie in Lycia with you?

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: Uh-huh. We moved there when I saw it firsthand with you. She's waiting for me now in Pherae.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Really? That's good. I'd enjoy seeing her again sometime.

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: She feels the same way about you. Someday... When you've free time, will you come for a visit?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Yes, of course! Once the fighting's done, I'll definitely come see you.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Command Bauker… He was a fierce enemy. Lyndis, once we’ve defeated the remaining foe, the castle’s yours.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Thank you, Eliwood. If not for your help, I don’t know where I’d be right now.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: All of this happened because we routed Lord Darin at Laus. It’s only right that we help.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You explained your motives to me, Eliwood. This is about your father. I would do the same thing in your position. What happened in Caelin is not your fault.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Thank you. However, until your castle is yours again, I take responsibility.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I understand. Thank you.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Eliwood! We’re moving into the castle!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: All right.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Who’s that?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Oh, yes. Let me introduce you. Hector!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: This is Lyndis. She’s Lord Hausen’s granddaughter. Lyndis, this is Hector. He’s Lord Uther’s brother.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: His brother? Really?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I was watching the way he fights… He’s not like you, Eliwood. He’s somewhat like my own knights, but different still. He relies so much on power. It’s like he’s never been…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I haven’t. I taught myself how to fight.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I’ve no issue with that, but the way you swing that axe around… You’re a threat to your allies! You should be more watchful.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What did you say?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lyndis? What’s come over you?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Hm? Oh…I… My apologies. I didn’t intend to seem so critical.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Granted, Hector’s style may be a tad dangerous, but… There’s no one I depend on more. You may think him careless, but he’s always aware of his surroundings.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: The more you praise me, the less worthy I sound.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lyndis, once you fight alongside Hector, I’m sure you’ll understand.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I’m sure you’re right. I apologize, Hector. I’m honored to have your help.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: No apology necessary. I’m glad I can lend a hand.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Let’s go inside, shall we?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Mark! Is it really you, Mark? So good to see you! Have you been well?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Well met, Mark. Good to see you again.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Well! This really is a pleasant surprise!

end.speaker: Wil
end.line: Hello, Mark! Has it really been a year?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What’s wrong, Florina? You needn’t hide back there.

end.speaker: Florina
end.line: Um… Nice to see you again. I don’t suppose you… Do you…remember me?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Everyone who remained in Caelin speaks of you fondly. We’re always saying “I wonder where Mark is…” Yes…you’re right. This isn’t the best time to catch up. We’re here to rescue my grandfather. Mark, will you help me again?

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: Ri…Ridiculous… Even Bauker?

end.speaker: Hausen
end.line: Lord Darin, it’s time to give up this madness. Further resistance is meaningless. For what you’ve done, you may never be forgiven, but it’s not too late to try. Tell Eliwood everything. He’ll intervene with Marquess Ostia on your behalf…

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: I…I’ve…lost…

end.speaker: Hausen
end.line: Hurry! Eliwood will be here in no time. Let me speak for you. Gurr… Guaaaa!!

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: None of that now. Marquess Laus needs no troublesome advice.

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: L-Lord Ephidel?

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: There is no turning back for you now. You should know that. First, Marquess Santaruz… and now Marquess Caelin. Both deaths are on your head.

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: What? It was by your hand that they both died! I-I never asked for this.

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: Yes, I killed them… for you.

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: To…trap me?

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: Don’t be absurd. I follow my master’s orders. My only wish is to deliver your dreams to you. The crown of a united Lycia…. And once that is done, dominion over the entire continent. Is that not what you desire?

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: … … …Yes…Yes, of course. That dream IS still worth a few sacrifices, isn’t it?

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: You’re exactly right. Our plans may have gone drastically awry, but as long as we have the master’s power behind us, we cannot be defeated. We’d do well to leave now, before those meddlesome worms arrive. You will leave everyone from Laus behind. We will use them to delay our foe.

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: Everyone… My soldiers? But…who will protect me?

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: The Black Fang and I will more than suffice for that task. There is nothing else you need, I assure you.

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: Yes…I…I see that now. Where do we go from here?

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: To the Dragon’s Gate… Our master awaits us there. The master has informed me our hostage may be all we need. If all goes well, we may be able to perform the ceremony with him alone.

end.speaker: Darin
end.line: Oh! Is that so? I suppose we’ve nothing to worry about.

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: That is correct. Now please, begin your retreat. I have two or three orders to give, then I will be right behind you.

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: Pathetic imbecile… Leila? Where are you?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: I’m here.

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: While Eliwood is occupied, finish off Marquess Caelin and hide the body. The enemy will waste precious time searching for him.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: As you command…

end.speaker: Ephidel
end.line: You know, you’ve only been with the Black Fang a short while. However, you are quite skilled… I look forward to watching you.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Yes, sir.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Ah, you there! You’re Caelin knights, aren’t you? Marquess Laus’s man, the one called Bauker... He seems like a gentle man, but his skill is near legendary. Do you carry weapons suited to battling knights? Take this if you please.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Different shops carry different items for sale. If you find something you’ve never seen, you should buy it, just to try. By the way, have you been to the local shop? If not, you should drop in. My daughter runs the place.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: You’re all Caelin knights, are you not? What? Lord Hausen’s still in the castle? Oh... This was to be for our daughter’s wedding, but... Here. Please help Marquess Caelin. Our lord needs rescuing.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Weapons are only as strong as the material they’re made of. Most of the weapons you have now are made of iron, right? Iron is a poor match for steel, and poorer still for silver! Slim weapons are weaker than iron ones, but easier to wield. Good weapons are expensive, but they’re worth the cost.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Your company seems close-knit. It’s vital to have friends who support and assist you, isn’t it? You have to be close to someone if you really want to get along. Stay close to those with whome you’re compatible to strengthen your bond. A reading by a fortune-teller will tell you who you’re compatible with. But don’t become so concerned about it that you forget to fight!
